LanguageData.NightVisionMeleeHitTip: Effects melee hit chance, dodge chance, and gives a chance for a sneak attack (can be disabled separately)
LanguageData.NightVisionSAtkTip: A 100 % to hit, undodgeable attack.\nChance = this x (attacker's light multiplier - target's)
LanguageData.NightVisionRangedHitTip:
Light multiplier effects ranged hit chance.
Has less of an effect (negative or positive) at hit chances close to 100%.
i.e. at close range or with high shooting skill.
Will never give 100% hit chance - but gets close
LanguageData.NightVisionRangedCDTip:
Depends on light multiplier and shooting skill.
High skill implies a greater positive effect and a diminished negative effect.
And vice-versa for low skill.
Multiplies the weapon's cooldown
LanguageData.NightVisionRangedCDToCaps: Link cooldown min/max to light multiplier caps:
LanguageData.NightVisionRangedCDToCapsTip: Min: ( 1 / max light multiplier). \n Max: ( 1 / min light multiplier )
LanguageData.NightVisionRangedCDMinMax: The min and max of ranged cooldown multipliers in %:
LanguageData.NightVisionRangedCDMinMaxTip: Higher is worse.\nWorst value is with 0 shooting and worst light multiplier.\nBest value is with 20 shooting and best light multiplier.
LanguageData.NightVisionHitCurve: The curve steepness for hit calculations (ranged and melee):
LanguageData.NightVisionHitCurveTip:
Higher = more extreme drop off in hit chance with a bad light multiplier.
Recommended = 2.
[Flat]: 80% => 70%.
[2]: 80% => 60%.
[Extreme]: 80% => 25%.
LanguageData.NightVisionDodgeCurve: The curve steepness for dodge calculations
LanguageData.NightVisionDodgeCurveTip: Effect on dodge depends on (Attacker's light multiplier - Dodger's).\nRecommended = 3.\n Higher than hit curve because values being dealt with are smaller.
